questions.text: A televised celebration of the USS VOYAGER's return to Earth opens the episode. What anniversary of VOYAGER's return is being celebrated?
questions.explanation:
the tenth.

	The 'future' we see in this episode takes place ten years after VOYAGER finally made it home.

questions.text: According to the 'future' we see in this episode, how long was the USS VOYAGER in the Delta Quadrant before finally making it home?
questions.explanation:
23 years.

	In the 'original' history, VOYAGER needed another 16 years (after the seven years of the series) to make it back to Earth.

questions.text: In the 'future,' what name has The Doctor finally chosen for himself?
questions.explanation:
Joe.

	The Doctor took the name of his new wife's grandfather. Louis Zimmerman is the name of his creator. Schmalles is the name The Doctor's Vidiian compatriot gave him in the early seasons of the series. Tiberius, of course, is James T. Kirk's middle name.

questions.text: What is the name of The Doctor's new wife in the 'future'?
questions.explanation:
Lana.

	When The Doctor first arrives with his new wife, she is shot from behind. With her long blonde hair and shapely physique, we're obviously meant to think, at first, that The Doctor has married Seven Of Nine. A nice little tease, that.

questions.text: In the 'future,' what is the name of Captain Harry Kim's starship?
questions.explanation:
USS RHODE ISLAND.

	Harry has just returned from a four-year-long deep space mission when the events of the 'future' segment play out.

questions.text: In both the 'future' and present segments of this episode, a toast is made -- in the 'future' by Reginald Barclay; in the present, by Tom Paris. What is the three-word phrase that each man speaks, as everyone in each room raises their glasses?
questions.explanation:
To the journey.

	In the 'future,' the toast was made with champagne, at the anniversary party for VOYAGER's return to Earth. In the present, the toast is made with coffee, when the senior officers decide not to take the shortcut home, but rather deliver a crippling blow to the Borg.

questions.text: Seven of Nine prepares a picnic in Cargo Bay 2 for Chakotay and herself. According to her research, a picnic is an appropriate setting for which date?
questions.explanation:
the third.

	We later learn that her 'research' was nothing more than advice from Neelix.

questions.text: In Neelix's absence, a crewman has stepped forth and requested an appointment as the new head chef for VOYAGER. Which of the following dishes does NOT appear on his sample menu that Janeway and Chakotay chuckle over?
questions.explanation:
Dilithium Delight.

	I make a pretty mean Red Alert Chili myself. =)

questions.text: Who played the Borg Queen in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Alice Krige.

	Krige reprised the role she played in the movie 'Star Trek: First Contact.' Thompson played the Borg Queen in all of that character's 'Voyager' appearances except for this one. Susie Plakson played several roles on 'Star Trek: The Next Generation,' and played a female Q in the 'Voyager' episode 'The Q and the Gray.' Mimi Kuzyk was a regular on 'Hill Street Blues,' and played Sam Beckett's wife on 'Quantum Leap.'

questions.text: Tuvok first becomes concerned about his neurological ailment after he is beaten in a game of Kal'To. Who beats him?
questions.explanation:
Icheb.

	Tuvok notes to The Doctor that he lost the game of logic, strategy, and patience due to 'another lapse in concentration.'

questions.text: When Admiral Janeway arrives from the 'future,' she muses to Captain Janeway that in her era, VOYAGER is a museum. Where is this museum located?
questions.explanation:
The Presidio.

	The Presidio, an army base in 2001, is apparently still standing in late 24th century San Francisco, presumably not far from Starfleet Academy. Admiral Janeway goes on to note that, when in the VOYAGER museum, 'on a clear day you can see Alcatraz.'

questions.text: In the 'future' segment, Tuvok is institutionalized. When Admiral Janeway goes to visit him for the last time, Tuvok lists off several people who visit him regularly. Which of the following is NOT one of the people he names?
questions.explanation:
Tom Paris.

	Janeway and The Doctor visit on specific days of the week, while Barclay's visits are 'more erratic.' I find it odd that Paris doesn't regularly visit his old friend Tuvok, to whom he owes his life several times over.

questions.text: In the 'future' segment, what does Tom Paris do for a living?
options: he is a Lieutenant Commander in Starfleet Intelligence
he teaches helm control at Starfleet Academy
he acts as a consultant to the Utopia Plenitia Shipyards
questions.explanation:
he writes holo-novels.

	Paris spent plenty of time creating holodeck scenarios during his years on VOYAGER, and apparently, it's paid off.

questions.text: In the 'future' segment, what does Admiral Janeway do for a living?
options: she advises Starfleet Command in all Borg-related matters
she is the Director of Starfleet Intelligence
questions.explanation:
she teaches at Starfleet Academy.

	While Janeway's expertise on the Borg is well-documented, her official Starfleet assignment is teaching at the Academy.

questions.text: In the 'future,' admirals apparently operate on a system similar to that evinced by army generals in 2001 -- one can have 'stars' delineating one's rank from higher- or lower-ranked admirals. According to the pips on Admiral Janeway's uniform, how many 'stars' does she have?
questions.explanation:
three.

	At Janeway's collar, we see three pips inside a rectangle. It's a safe bet that only four-'star' admirals outrank her...and there can't be too many of those in Starfleet.

questions.text: In the 'future' segment, what is Reginald Barclay's rank?
questions.explanation:
Commander.

	You'd think that Barclay would have risen higher after 23 years -- he's a Lieutenant in the 'present' -- but, no.

questions.text: What does Seven Of Nine bring to her dinner date with Chakotay?
options: a tactical report on the Borg
questions.explanation:
flowers.

	Chakotay is interrupted in his effort to put the flowers in water when Seven kisses him quite suddenly.

questions.text: At the anniversary party in the 'future,' whose child strikes up a conversation with Harry Kim?
questions.explanation:
Naomi Wildman's.

	The young 'captain's assistant' has apparently grown up and become a mother. Harry asks the child to go and fetch her mother, but we never get to see the adult Naomi.

questions.text: In the 'future,' Janeway visits Chakotay's grave before embarking upon her mission. A Starfleet insignia is carved on his headstone.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It looks almost like the Starfleet insignia, but it contains a 'whirly' circle instead.

questions.text: In the 'present' segment, how many 'false alarms' has the very pregnant B'Elanna Torres had, according to Janeway and Chakotay?
questions.explanation:
three.

	Janeway notes that the baby is as stubborn as her mother.

questions.text: What weapon modification has VOYAGER been able to make with the help of their guest from the 'future,' Admiral Janeway?
questions.explanation:
trans-phasic torpedoes.

	The trans-phasic torpedoes prove capable of destroying a Borg cube with a single shot.

questions.text: The VOYAGER crew discovers one of the Borg's trans-warp hubs inside the heavily-guarded nebula. According to Seven Of Nine, how many such hubs exist in the galaxy?
questions.explanation:
six.

	The VOYAGER crew decides that crippling this particular hub would be a significant blow to the Borg, who use the hubs to gain instant access to multiple locations throughout the galaxy.

questions.text: Admiral Janeway eventually reveals to Captain Janeway that, if she refuses to take the shortcut home that the Borg trans-warp hub offers, several of her crewmembers will die in the subsequent journey to the Alpha Quadrant. Including Seven Of Nine, how many crewmembers will die?
questions.explanation:
22.

	The admiral reveals the names of none of the ill-fated crewmembers other than Seven Of Nine.

questions.text: When VOYAGER arrives in the Alpha Quadrant, how many starships are there to welcome them?
questions.explanation:
18.

	It's stated that nine more ships are on their way, but when VOYAGER arrives, there are 18 ships present.

questions.text: What is the last line spoken in the episode, and therefore the series?
questions.explanation:
'Set a course...for home.'

	Appropriately, Captain Janeway speaks this final, momentous line.
